nodes.bodyText: We might want to stick to CheckpointType here instead of String
done
"checkpoint" is one word. Hence, we should name variables, classes, and other literals like accordingly, i.e. FIELD_NAME_CHECKPOINT_TYPE, "checkpoint_type", or checkpointType.
done

You shouldn't edit this file manually. Instead, you can run org.apache.flink.runtime.rest.compatibility.RestAPIStabilityTest#testDispatcherRestAPIStability with -Dgenerate-rest-snapshot to generate the file from sources and commit it. That's going to be easier and less error-prone than editing the file manually. It will also make org.apache.flink.runtime.rest.compatibility.RestAPIStabilityTest to succeed (as it is not right now) again after an API change. :-)

nodes.bodyText:
is this related to this PR?
also the next similar change in this file?
it does not look related to checkpointing, then it should be addressed at least in a separate hotfix commit or better in another PR/Jira issue.
this was auto-generated code.. not related to this change.. will open jira issue and commit this change separately.
This was already fixed in PR #13403 and merged into master. Rebasing the branch should fix this diff.
@XComp PR #13403  only fixed html documentation.. here it's missing in rest_api_v1.snapshot

this change also looks unrelated.
it looks like a minor code style fix which we usually do not do to preserve git history.
if we do the code style fixes then it is usually either

massively in files which have a lot of code style violation in separate commit
or close to related changes

nodes.bodyText: Why did you add the state_backend here? It looks like it's not needed? 🤔
actually, this field is missing from the rest API object spec and this interface so just add it keep them in sync
I forgot to mention in the other review: It's always good to call Preconditions.checkNotNull on nullable parameters. See other status as an example.
sure I can do that.

Hi @gm7y8
it would be better to move this calculation into the typescript file as a getter, and binding the getter here, since the calculation is a little too complex for the template file
@vthinkxie makes sense. I moved this into function in the ts file.

it would be better to checkPointType as a value other than a function here
then move the calculation to line 65
done.
